Package fs.xml

Interface Summary
ResourceDependent This interface indicates that a class, especially the implementation, depends on certain file resources (usually Schema files, templates, etc..).
ResourceReference This interface can be understood as the dual interface to ResourceDependent.
XMLConfigurable Defines a type to be XML - configurable, i.e.
 

Class Summary
ConstantResourceReference Convenience class that serves as a constant reference, that is, always returns "base path" + "query path" for its interface method.
FsfwConfigurator Instances of this class can be used to configure global properties of fsframework, such as the default language, a resource directory, etc...
FsfwDefaultReference A singleton class used to retrieve file paths to resources of fsframework.
PolyglotStringLoader A kind of read-only facade for a PolyglotStringTable.
PolyglotStringTable Implements a table of strings, each identified by unique String ID and potentially available in multiple languages.
ResourceDirectory A ResourceDirectory is used to summarize several ResourceDependent objects that use a common resource reference (e.g.
XMLConfigureFile Represents a file that is used to store, read and apply configurations in XML formats.
XMLDirectoryTree Implements an extension of DefaultDocument which contains some convenient methods to create an XML document representing a file/directory hierarchy, such as accessing nodes via filepaths.
XMLToolbox This class contains a variety of useful static functions that implement certain frequently used XML operations in a standard way.
 

Exception Summary
XMLReadConfigurationException Acts as a wrapper for all exceptions that might occur while trying to read a configuration from an object via its XMLConfigurable interface
XMLWriteConfigurationException Acts as a wrapper to all exceptions that might occur while trying to configure an object via its XMLConfigurable interface.
